Brazilian.title: Feijoada
ingredients: 1 lb pork shoulder, cut into chunks
Brazilian.instructions: Cook beans until tender. Brown all meats separately. Add onions and garlic, cook until soft. Add meats to beans with seasonings. Simmer for 2 hours until tender. Serve with rice and orange slices.

Brazilian.title: Pão de Açúcar
Brazilian.instructions: Dissolve yeast in warm water with sugar. Mix flour, salt, butter, eggs, and milk. Add yeast mixture and knead until smooth. Let rise for 1 hour. Shape into rolls and let rise again. Bake at 375°F for 20 minutes. Brush with melted butter and sprinkle with sugar.

Brazilian.title: Brigadeiro
Brazilian.instructions: Mix condensed milk, cocoa powder, and butter in saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and pulls away from pan. Remove from heat and add vanilla. Let cool completely. Roll into balls and coat with sprinkles. Chill before serving.

Brazilian.title: Moqueca de Peixe
Brazilian.instructions: Marinate fish with lime juice, garlic, and seasonings for 30 minutes. Heat palm oil and cook onions and peppers until soft. Add tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes. Add fish and coconut milk. Simmer for 15 minutes until fish is cooked. Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice.

Brazilian.title: Açaí Bowl
Brazilian.instructions: Blend açaí puree with banana until smooth. Pour into bowl. Top with granola, berries, chia seeds, and coconut flakes. Drizzle with honey and almond butter. Serve immediately.

Argentine.title: Asado
Argentine.instructions: Mix olive oil with garlic, herbs, salt, and pepper. Rub mixture over all meats. Grill over medium heat, turning frequently, until cooked through. Serve with chimichurri sauce.

Argentine.title: Empanadas
Argentine.instructions: Make dough with flour, lard, water, and salt. Let rest for 30 minutes. Brown ground beef with onion and garlic. Add spices and cook for 10 minutes. Add eggs and olives. Roll dough and cut into circles. Fill with meat mixture and seal. Bake at 375°F for 25 minutes until golden.

Argentine.title: Dulce de Leche
Argentine.instructions: Remove label from can and place in large pot. Cover with water and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 3 hours, adding water as needed. Let cool completely before opening. Mix with vanilla extract. Serve as spread or filling.

Argentine.title: Chimichurri
Argentine.instructions: Chop parsley, cilantro, and garlic finely. Mix with vinegar, oil, and seasonings. Let sit for 30 minutes to blend flavors. Serve with grilled meats.

Argentine.title: Alfajores
Argentine.instructions: Mix flour, cornstarch, sugar, butter, egg yolks, vanilla, baking powder, and salt. Knead until smooth. Roll out and cut into circles. Bake at 350°F for 12 minutes. Cool completely. Spread dulce de leche between two cookies. Dust with powdered sugar.

Peruvian.title: Peruvian Ceviche
Peruvian.instructions: Marinate fish in lime and orange juice for 30 minutes. Add onion, jalapeños, salt, and pepper. Mix well and chill for 1 hour. Serve with sweet potato, corn, and lettuce leaves.

Peruvian.title: Lomo Saltado
Peruvian.instructions: Heat oil in large skillet. Cook beef until browned. Add onions, tomatoes, jalapeños, and garlic. Cook for 5 minutes. Add soy sauce, vinegar, and seasonings. Cook for 5 minutes more. Serve with French fries and rice.

Peruvian.title: Aji de Gallina
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken breast, cooked and shredded
Peruvian.instructions: Heat oil and cook onions, garlic, and jalapeños until soft. Add walnuts, cheese, stock, and cream. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add chicken and turmeric. Simmer for 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with rice and olives.

Peruvian.title: Anticuchos
ingredients: 2 lbs beef heart, cut into cubes
Peruvian.instructions: Marinate beef heart in vinegar, aji pastes, garlic, and seasonings for 2 hours. Thread onto skewers. Grill over medium heat, turning frequently, until cooked through. Serve with grilled corn.

Peruvian.title: Pisco Sour
Peruvian.instructions: Shake Pisco, lime juice, simple syrup, and egg white with ice. Strain into glass. Add bitters on top. Serve immediately.

Colombian.title: Bandeja Paisa
Colombian.instructions: Cook beans until tender. Brown ground beef with onion, garlic, and seasonings. Cook chorizo and pork belly separately. Fry eggs sunny-side up. Fry plantains until golden. Arrange all components on large platter. Serve immediately.

Colombian.title: Arepas
Colombian.instructions: Mix cornmeal with warm water and salt. Let rest for 5 minutes. Add butter and cheese. Form into patties. Cook in oil until golden on both sides. Serve warm.

Colombian.title: Sancocho
Colombian.instructions: Brown all meats in large pot. Add onions, garlic, and tomatoes. Cook until soft. Add water and seasonings. Simmer for 1 hour. Add vegetables and simmer for 30 minutes. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.

Colombian.title: Empanadas Colombianas
Colombian.instructions: Make dough with flour, lard, water, and salt. Let rest for 30 minutes. Brown ground beef with onion and garlic. Add spices and cook for 10 minutes. Add eggs and olives. Roll dough and cut into circles. Fill with meat mixture and seal. Fry in hot oil until golden.

Colombian.title: Ajiaco
Colombian.instructions: Brown chicken in large pot. Add onions, garlic, and tomatoes. Cook until soft. Add stock and seasonings. Simmer for 1 hour. Add vegetables and simmer for 30 minutes. Garnish with cilantro and serve with avocado and sour cream.

Colombian.title: Quick Brazilian Açaí Bowl
Colombian.instructions: Blend açaí puree with banana until smooth. Pour into bowl. Top with granola, berries, coconut flakes, and chia seeds. Drizzle with honey. Serve immediately.

Colombian.title: Quick Brazilian Cheese Bread
Colombian.instructions: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Pour into mini muffin tins. Bake at 400°F for 15-20 minutes until golden. Serve warm.

Colombian.title: Quick Argentine Empanadas
Colombian.instructions: Cook beef with onion and garlic until browned. Add spices and season with salt and pepper. Fill dough circles with mixture. Seal edges and bake at 375°F for 20 minutes until golden.

Colombian.title: Quick Peruvian Ceviche
ingredients: Sweet potato and corn for serving
Colombian.instructions: Marinate fish in lime juice for 10 minutes. Add onion, jalapeños, cilantro, and salt. Mix well. Serve with sweet potato and corn.

Colombian.title: Quick Colombian Arepas
Colombian.instructions: Mix flour with water and salt. Knead until smooth. Form into patties. Cook in butter for 5 minutes per side. Fill with cheese and serve hot.

Colombian.title: Quick Chilean Completo
Colombian.instructions: Cook hot dogs. Toast buns. Spread mashed avocado on buns. Add hot dogs, tomatoes, sauerkraut, mayonnaise, and mustard. Serve immediately.

Colombian.title: Quick Venezuelan Arepas
ingredients: Shredded chicken and cheese for filling
Colombian.instructions: Mix cornmeal with water and salt. Let rest for 5 minutes. Form into patties. Cook in oil for 5 minutes per side. Split and fill with chicken and cheese.

Colombian.title: Quick Mexican Street Corn
Colombian.instructions: Grill corn until charred. Mix mayonnaise and sour cream. Brush corn with mixture. Sprinkle with cheese, chili powder, and lime juice. Garnish with cilantro.

Colombian.title: Quick Cuban Sandwich
Colombian.instructions: Spread mustard on bread. Layer pork, ham, cheese, and pickles. Butter outside of bread. Press in panini press for 5 minutes until golden and cheese melts.

Colombian.title: Quick Puerto Rican Mofongo
Colombian.instructions: Fry plantains until golden. Mash with garlic, olive oil, and cracklings. Season with salt. Form into balls and serve hot.
